data.text:
Educator

Steve Bingham studied violin with Emmanuel Hurwitz, Sidney Griller and the Amadeus Quartet at the Royal Academy of Music from 1981 to 1985. In 1985 he founded the Bingham String Quartet, an ensemble that has become one of the leading quartets.in the UK, performing classical and contemporary repertoire. The quartet has recorded many CDs, worked for radio and television, toured in Europe, the Middle East and Australia, and collaborated with prominent musicians. Steve Bingham is also a dedicated violin teacher, editor of the European String Teachers Association, and teaches many chamber music courses and regular school workshops for all ages. He is particularly known for his excellent communication skills and enthusiasm.

Educator

Nora Scheidig completed her studies at the Hochschule für Musik in Dresden and Weimar, where she studied with Prof. Malinowski and Prof. Wollong. Collaborations with internationally renowned artists such as Friedemann Eichhorn, Nora Chastain, Yair Kless, Ingolf Turban and Ivan Zenaty shaped her artistic personality. On a chamber music level, she also received stimulation from renowned artists such as Natalia Prishepenko, Jan Vogler, Lise Berthaud and Lise de la Salle. Nora Scheidig performs regularly as a soloist and chamber musician at home and abroad with, among others, Duo Dopico, the dogma chamber orchestra and as a substitute in orchestras such as the Sächsische Staatskapelle Dresden and the Konzerthausorchester Berlin. In addition to her artistic diversity, Nora Scheidig is a passionate pedagogue committed to promoting young talent.

Educator

Shirly Laub studied with Clemens Quatacker in Brussels and with Viktor Liberman and Philippe Hirshhorn in Utrecht. From 1998 to 2005 she was one of the concertmasters of the London Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, the Royal Opera House and the BBC orchestras. In 2001, she joined the Silk Road Ensemble in New York, with which she toured around the world accompanied by Yo-Yo Ma, among others. Shirly Laub is also active in education, having taught violin at the Royal College of Music and Trinity College London, and at conservatories in Madrid, Kumamoto, Beijing and Miami. Since 2003 she has been a violin teacher at the Conservatoire Royal in Brussels.

Educator

Edoardo graduated with honors from the Conservatory of Music in Milan and was a student of Pierre Amoyal in Lausanne from 2005-2007. He is the winner of the International Violin Competition “Viotti Valsesia” in 2003, where he was also the youngest competitor. Edoardo has given concerts in many European countries and in China, he has been a soloist in many orchestras and has collaborated with several eminent artists. Since 2012 he has been professor of violin at the Conservatorio di Santa Cecilia in Rome.

Educator

She was born in 1992 and graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts. She won the 1st prize and Audience Award in the 10th Tokyo Music Competition, the Career Development Awards at the Banff International String Quartet Competition 2016, and the 1st prize in the 67th ARD Munich International Music Competition as Aoi Trio. She has performed as a Soloist with Tokyo Symphony Orchestra, New Japan Philharmonic Orchestra and other orchestras in Tokyo. She participated in the Ozawa International Chamber Music Academy Okushiga and Zermatt Music Festival and Saito Kinen Orchestra. She has performed at Sommerliche Musiktage Hitzacker, Festspiele Mecklenburg-Vorpommern , Musika Bayreuth, Brahms Tage in Baden-Baden and Raderbergkonzert in Cologne.She has played as the Vorspirler in the Tokyo Philharmony Orchestra for one year. She studied at Karajan Akademie der Berliner Philharmoniker until April 2021 and she played in Berliner Philharmoniker many time. Currently she is studying at Hochschule Musik und Theatre München with Prof.Dirk Mommertz.

https://www.kyokoogawa-vn.com/

Expert, performer, master classes presenter

Agata Szymczewska is Polish violinist, winner of the 13th Henryk Wieniawski International Violin Competition in Poznań in 2006. Winner of the London Music Masters award, primarius of the renowned Karol Szymanowski String Quartet. She has been working regularly with students as an educator for over 10 years now, and she finds this work to be a great way to share the experience she has gained and an inspiring area to exchange ideas. She is currently employed at the Frédéric Chopin University of Music in Warsaw as a Doctor of Musical Arts. She gives numerous lectures, masterclasses and demonstration lessons in many places in Poland and abroad. She plays three roles in the Music from Chopin’s Land project: she is the subject matter expert, performer of violin works included in the campaign, and presenter of master classes for violin teachers in Cardiff and Cremona.
